root: ^As you step into this room the ceiling begins to grind slowly downwards. A classic trap. Kyeh kobolds such as yourself are trained on a diet of cave ins and falling boulders. You can do this.

b: ^You step outside of the room. These things are usually on a timer so you can wait till it starts to rise and walk through at your leisure.

c-0: ^You wait for the ceiling to continue its tedious crawl to the bottom. It finally reaches the floor with a thud.
^You notice a gold coin embedded in the stonework and prise it free with the head of your spear.
^You stand there for a minute. It's not moving.

c-1: ^You listen for any telltale signs of movement. Only silence. You're about to give it a kick in frustration but then it slowly begins to rise.

c-0: ^You wait for it to reach halfway. You could make a run for it.

c-1: ^It's nearly back to where it started. You can casually jog to an exit now.

b: ^You wait whilst the roof of the room continues its slow creep downwards. A thump comes from inside the walls and it stops halfway. Is it broken?

c-0: ^You commit to running through and the ceiling begins to move again.
c-1: ^It seems to be stuck. You're about to duck and walk through when it starts up again.

c-0: ^The ceiling finally meets the floor. You cast an eye over the barrier before you, looking for more rewards. Along the top edge you see an inscription:
^Various and valued matter, made portable and flatter.
^Unfortunately there's nothing you carry that needs this service. You wait for the wall to rise but minutes pass without sound or motion.

c-1: ^It refuses to budge. You kick it. You beat your palm on it.

b: ^You wait whilst the roof of the room passes a third of the way down before sharply slamming in to the floor. You jump back with a gust of dust and grit following you. It rises up swiftly, ignoring its former character.
^A few beats pass before it nonchalantly rises to its starting position. It waits. Your move.

^You wait and the roof descends only inch and stops. You wait for a moment, waving your spear and then a hand underneath to see if it will attempt to crush them. You tap the ceiling with the butt of your spear, punctuating the test with a sharp blow that knocks a few chips of stone away. Nothing.
^Try to walk through the room. (0-2 effort)

c-1: ^You pace back and forth, giving the ceiling a few more pokes to provoke it. The roof is unmoved by your threats.
^Try to walk through the room. (0-2 effort)

b: ^You pause and the roof smashes down into the floor in reply. It sulks, refusing to move.

s1: ^It seems to have tired of this game.

returning: ^You return to the room with the crushing ceiling.

s0: ^It seems to sense your presence and taunts you by lowering.
s1: ^It greets you with its familar grind to the floor.

knees: ^You walk through the room with knees bent ready to make an escape. The trap appears not to care.

s0: ^your feet raising dust and clawed toes scraping against the flagstones.
s1: ^a squeak sounding from your back foot as it fights to push you ahead.
s2: ^ducking low with your tail outstretched to counterbalance your charge.

b: ^There's a metallic snap from within the walls. You've enough time to figure out that it was probably a chain link breaking. But not enough time to escape the ceiling smashing into you with its unstoppable mass.
^You accelerate towards an exit with ease. The roof of the room slowly closing after you.

s0: ^stumble into a roll, scrambling to retrieve your spear before making a mad crawl to an exit.
s1: ^are forced to slide across the floor as the ceiling threatens to leave no escape. You barely manage to tuck your tail in before it slams shut.
s2: ^are forced to run practically on all fours as the ceiling accelerates downwards.

s0: ^Your repeated transits must have excited it.
